title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message:
I have an 820-00165-A with no image. 

The F7700 has 8.6V, and 8.6V on EDP_BKLT_EN/Q7707.
D7701 has 0.02
BKL_EN = 0.012V
BLK_PWM = 0.012V

Need help please.

title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message:
Stop looking for backlight when missing image.

Do you get voltage at pins 14, and18/19 of J8300?
Check with LCD connected.

title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message: no power at pin 14/18/19 its like 0.002

title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message:
ok got it up and running going to os bot no back light
Fuse is ok.

title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message:
Pins 18/19 MUST get voltage in the first few seconds (when chime).
This voltage is not maintained, if pin 14 will not go high in this time.
And of course, image and backlight are not enabled.

title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message: hello pin 18/19 has about 3.3 when1st boot.

title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message:
"This voltage is not maintained, if pin 14 will not go high in this time."
???

title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message: Hello Informaticos, D7701 is running 8.5 on both ends R7704 has a voltage of 1.5 should be 3.3 right ? you think U7701 is bad ?

title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message:
8.5V at D7701 means LCD is recognized; there should be also image.

1.5V at PWM is classic when no backlight.
First try PRAM reset 2-3 times.
If still the same, remove R7704 and tie together BKL_EN/PWM.

title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message: Pram Didnt work, going to remove R7704 and tie BLK_EN and BLK_PWM, if that solve the problem whats the issue then?

title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message: BLK_EN and BLK_PWM connection did not help

title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message:
Do you have now 3V at BKL_EN/PWM?
Did you check XW7720?
Post diode mode to ground at both pins of D7701 and all return resistors.
Look for corrosion at A5 ball of U7701.

title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message:
[ATTACH type="full" width="168px"]59468[/ATTACH]
there is no xw7702 next to the d7701

title: Macbook AIR 1466 no screen
message:
That bright point between L7701 and D7701 is just XW7720!!!
And looks good in your case.

Think a bit more next time, before doing such afirmation...
